intro: Allium curtum subsp. palaestinum, commonly known as the Palestine leek, is a perennial herb native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces umbels of small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
